alert.note: Alert for Iron (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Duluth (Northeast Minnesota and Northern Wisconsin)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 12 at 2:49PM CDT by NWS Duluth
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Iron County through 315 PM CDT... At 248 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Upson, or 10 miles southwest of Ironwood, moving northeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...Penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor hail damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Gile around 255 PM CDT. Hurley around 300 PM CDT. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...<30 MPH
info.instruction: Anyone outdoors, including anyone on or in the water, should seek shelter inside a sturdy building or hard topped vehicle. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 500 PM CDT for northwestern Wisconsin.
